Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Mobile Bearing and Fixed Bearing Total Knee Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: Patients were randomised to receive either MB (n=252) or FB (n=255) devices.

Participants.evidence: 416 eligible patients at a single center

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomised to receive either MB (n=252) or FB (n=255) devices.

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial aimed to evaluate whether mobile bearing (MB) total knee arthroplasty (TKA) offers superior function, survivorship, and fewer complications compared to fixed bearing (FB) TKA.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in WOMAC Index scores over 24 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Patients were blinded to treatment allocation.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Revision occurred in 19/252 MB and 13/255 FB knees.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Estimated 6-year survival was 90.1% (95% CI, 84.1–93.9) for MB and 94.2% (95% CI, 90.1–96.6) for FB.

Harms.evidence: Device failures and complications were recorded until October 2009.
